section.title: alarm
section.para: alarm command interacts with javax.slee.management:name=Alarm Bean. It is standard SLEE MBean. alarm command allows to manage alarms, for instance check for existence or remove. . It supports following operations:

section.title: clear
section.para: clear operation turns down alarms based on criteria passed in options. It requires either --id or --nsrc to be present. clear command supports followiong options:

listitem.para: this option specifies id of alarm which should be cleared. Option requires string argument, example: 415f719e-3a3d-42b4-acc1-4e84706f031a. This option excludes other options.

specifies notification source for which alarms should be cleared. It requires argumnt which is valid notification source: RAEntityNotification[entity=LabRA]. This option excludes --id. Optionally it can be followed by --type.

specifies type of alarm to be cleared. Type is service/component implementation specific. Type of alarm is passed as alarms metadata when it is created. Option requires argument which is string representation of type. Example call

example.title: Clear alarms of certain type for ProfileTable

section.title: list
section.para: list operation lists all active alarms(their IDs). It does not require argument or option. It supports following options.

listitem.para: optional option. It specifies notification source. It limits list command output to alarms active for specified source. Requires argument which is valid notification source: ProfileTableNotification[table=SMSSubscription]

section.title: descriptor
section.para:
descriptor operation fetches metadata for particular alarm. This inclues message, timestamp, level,.. etc. It requires alarm ID as argument. It also accepts array argument. Members of array are separeted with ;. Example calls:
Fetch descriptor for alarm ./twiddle.sh alarm -d415f719e-3a3d-42b4-acc1-4e84706f031a
Fetch descriptor for alarms ./twiddle.sh alarm -d415f719e-3a3d-42b4-acc1-4e84706f031a;415f719e-3a3d-42b4-acc1-4e84706f031b;415f719e-3a3d-42b4-acc1-4e84706f031c

section.title: active
section.para: active operation simply checks if alarm is still active. It requires alarm id as argument.
